intro: Sessea atrovirens, commonly known as the black-barked sesse, is a woody plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark, often fissured bark and dense foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife.
